intro: Impatiens kinoleensis, commonly known as the Kinole Island impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kinole in the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
